meanings.definition: To establish or set securely or deeply
meanings.sent1: The tree roots were implanted firmly in the ground.
meanings.sent2: The dentist implanted the new tooth in the patient's mouth.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a talking dog implanted in my mind made me chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her words implanted a sense of doubt in his heart.
meanings.sent5: The memory of her smile was implanted in his mind forever.

meanings.definition: To insert or fix in a specified position
meanings.sent1: She implanted the key into the lock and turned it.
meanings.sent2: The surgeon implanted the pacemaker in the patient's chest.
meanings.sent3: The image of a flying pig implanted in my head made me laugh.
meanings.sent4: His words implanted a sense of hope in her heart.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the crashing waves was implanted in his memory.
